page.title: 01Block Review,Five Roads
page.content: {Five Roads}village (population 400) lies 5.6km north of Llanelli on the B4309 Carmarthen-Llanelli road.The road lies on a ridge seperating head waters of the Lliedi and Morlais rivers.It lies at the meeting point of five roads leading to the villages and countryside around.It is a long established agricultural settlement but since the closure of the brickworks in 1967 most people commute to Llanelli or Cynheidre.Cynheidre village(population 100)is a small hamlet located 0.8 km north of Five Roads.The last remaining coalmine in the borough is here containing valuable anthracite reserves.The principle shafts and surface facilities are here although a further shaft is located 4.8km east.The NCB is currently prospecting with the Five Roads area for fresh reserves.
